definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
the sound of the wind/to soar
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to be sentimentally attached to sb or sth
variant of 繆斯|缪斯[Miu4 si1]
Samuel Johnson (1709-1784) or Dr Johnson, English writer and lexicographer
pinyin: Sai1 miu4 er3 · Yue1 han4 xun4

definition: variant of 悖謬|悖谬[bei4 miu4]

sentences.english: If you listen to Muzak carefully, you will probably recognize the names of many of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仔细听缪扎克，你可能会认可许多歌的名字。

sentences.english: My next life I want your heart, at least I do not jump you have to die.
sentences.chinese: 缪下辈子我要做你的心脏，至少我不跳你就得死。

sentences.english: About one-third of the people in America listen to "Muzak" everyday.
sentences.chinese: 约三分之一的美国人每天听“缪扎克”。

sentences.english: The boy who showed off his strength was Bartholomew! He was fond of showing himself.
sentences.chinese: 这个逞能的叫巴塞洛缪，特别喜欢表现自己。

sentences.english: You tried to buy it with eighty - four days at sea.
sentences.chinese: 缪你曾想拿在海上的八十四天来买它。

sentences.english: Instead, she went to London to study at Saint Bartholomew's Hospital.
sentences.chinese: 她转而前往伦敦的圣巴托罗缪医院进修。

sentences.english: It has been proven that Muzak does what it is designed to do.
sentences.chinese: 缪扎克做到了设计它的初衷已被证明。

definition: surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
